original: Gustav, folkskolinspektör, Trollhättan, f. 4/1/92 i Karlskoga. G. 21 m. Märta Hildegard Fallström. Barn: Sylvia f. 22, Torild 24, Torbjörn 25. — FolkskolH :ex. i Strängnäs 116, fil. kand. i Gbg 20, stud. i Wien 31. Lär. v. Karlsko|ga folikhögsk. 16-17, sön d : s k: seikr. i Sv. M i s s : fö rb. 19-23, folkskoll. i Grängesberg 23-33, komm. folkskolinsp. i Trollhättan sed. 34. V. ordf. i barnav :nd, utrymn :chef. , Arvid Håkan Herbert, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 3/2/01 i Gbg av ing. Carl W. o. Gharlotta Söderlind. G. 27 m. Elsa Cartlson. Barn: Siv f. 27, Gun 29, Bo 34, Carl-Gustaf 41. — Stud:ex. 20, utex. fr. CTH 23. Ing. v. Betong A-B Vestra Sverige i Gbg. Bland vårt lands främsta sim’hoppare mi. höga, raka hopp som spec. (»Fågeln»), etta i raka hopp v. olymp. sp. i Antwerpen 20, åtta i Paris 24, tvåa v. nord. mästersk. i Köpenh. 25, sv. mäst. i raika hopp 3i2, tvåa v. sv. mästersk. 24, 25, 33, 34 o. 36, trea 31 o. 35, tvåa i varier. hopp 25, 34 o. 35, tvåa i svikt-hopp 27 m. m., tillh. Simavd. 1902 i Gbg. Sv. simförb. hed :märke.
translated: Gustav, primary school inspector, Trollhättan, born on January 4, 1892 in Karlskoga. Married on February 21 with Märta Hildegard Fallström. Children: Sylvia, born in 1922, Torild in 1924, Torbjörn in 1925. Primary school degree: completed in Strängnäs 1916, Bachelor of Arts in Gothenburg 1920, studied in Vienna in 1931. Teacher at Karlskoga folk high school from 1916-1917, missionary work for the Swedish Missionary Association from 1919-1923, primary school teacher in Grängesberg from 1923-1933, municipal primary school inspector in Trollhättan since 1934. Vice chair of the child welfare association, head of evacuation, Arvid Håkan Herbert, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born on February 3, 1901 in Gothenburg, son of engineer Carl W. and Charlotta Söderlind. Married on May 27 with Elsa Cartlson. Children: Siv in 1927, Gun in 1929, Bo in 1934, Carl-Gustaf in 1941. Passed high school exams in 1920, graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1923. Engineer at Betong A-B West Sweden in Gothenburg. Among the country's top high diving athletes, known for high, straight dives (»Fågeln»), first place in straight dives at the Olympic Games in Antwerp in 1920, eighth place in Paris in 1924, second place at the Nordic Championships in Copenhagen in 1925, Swedish champion in straight dives in 1932, second place at the Swedish Championships in 1924, 1925, 1933, 1934, and 1936, third place in 1931 and 1935, second place in varied dives in 1925, 1934, and 1935, second place in springboard diving in 1927, etc., member of the Swimming Department in Gothenburg since 1902. Honorary medal of the Swedish Swimming Federation.

achievement.name: First place in straight dives, Olympic Games
